result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte O Weathers

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant Deonte O Weathers in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Deonte O Weathers.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for some electronic discovery and an offer.
State sends email to the charging DA.
Court passes matter to wait for a response.
Case recalled at 11:33 with Attorney Szczupakiewicz appearing for the State.
Statement by the State.
Statements by the Defense.
Hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 10:00 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Deonte O Weathers in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Deonte O Weathers.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received paper discovery and inquires if there is any electronic discovery.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Herbers
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on June 6, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/660 Woelfel Road listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:27 PM Defendant Deonte O Weathers in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
